eel.fact: Eels have a second set of jaws. You can see them on the x-ray.

crab.fact: This crab looks like it is ready to moult. Soon it will pop out of the shell and grow a bigger one!

lobster.fact: Lobsters are left or right handed just like people! Which claw looks stronger?

octopus.fact: Wow! An octopus! They are good at escaping because they can squeeze through very small holes.

butterflyfish.fact: This type of butterfly fish likes to live alone. When it finds a partner they stick together forever.

turtle.fact: Turtle shells are part of their skeleton. That makes It hard to x-ray them!

seahorse.fact: Oh wow! This seahorse is a male. It has a pouch for carrying the eggs.

hatchet_fish.fact: What’s this doing here? Hatchet fish are usually deep sea fish. They can have glowing dots on their stomachs.

bat2.fact: Can you imagine flying in the dark like this bat? They can’t use their eyes. They listen for their squeeks bouncing off the walls.

centipede.fact: That is one big centipede. It must be the kind that catches and eats bats!

gecko.fact: This gecko can climb up walls and even hang upside down! It helps them catch bugs to eat.

snake.fact: This snake has something special on it’s nose. That is called jacobson’s organ. It helps the snake feel an animal’s body heat.

spider1.fact: This spider likes to live in the dark. More animals get stuck in the web because they can’t see it.

whip_scorpion.fact: A whip scorpion! Don’t worry, they aren’t venomous. But when they get scared they can spray stuff that smells like vinegar.

mushroom.fact: This isn’t an animal! It's a mushroom!

mushroom2.fact: This isn’t an animal! It's a mushroom!
